summary: This is an email from a contractor at the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) to Geoffrey Berman, requesting permission to share a recent Epstein prosecution memo with an unnamed individual (likely a colleague) in advance of a human trafficking summit in Washington, D.C.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: US Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The recipient of the email, from whom permission is being sought to share an internal prosecution memo related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Human Trafficking Summit in Washington
events.description: An upcoming summit on human trafficking in Washington, D.C., mentioned as the reason for requesting the Epstein prosecution memo.

keyFacts: A 'recent Epstein pros memo' (prosecution memo) existed within the US Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) as of January 2020.
A contractor at USANYS sought permission from US Attorney Geoffrey Berman to share this internal memo with an unnamed individual.
The request was made in preparation for a human trafficking summit in Washington, D.C., indicating the memo's relevance to broader trafficking discussions.
The email demonstrates internal communication and protocol regarding the sharing of sensitive case materials related to the Epstein investigation.
